A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Star Wars has always required a heavy suspension of disbelief\, but this film requires a suspension of brain cells. A larger space ship that can't catch up with a smaller space ship... in a straight line in space. No one thought to turn on the hyper-drive? Audiences that waited years for Luke Skywalker to show up to a fight... nope. He just kinda dies. And then there's the Yoda appearance. Seriously? Whatever effort was placed into this movie\, none of it was spent on thought. An over-long\, hardly-fun insult of a franchise that just proved\, unlike its interminable rebellion\, it actually can't go on forever.
